availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph F. Blythe (Ghent, Carroll County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier, 32nd KY Infy)

body.p: Ghent, Carroll County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Son of William D. Blythe and Amanda M. Blythe. Farmer in Carroll County in 1863. Served as a private in the 32nd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) from August 1862 to May 1863

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carroll County, Ghent, p. 78.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Indiana, Jackson County, Ward (1) Seymour, p. 433A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Carroll County, KY, June-July 1863, p. 74, (Accessed via ancestry.com).
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0401.
